content:
Diagnosis:	Hepatocellular carcinoma, clear cell variant

Management:	Right hepatectomy March 2023
	Adjuvant sorafenib commenced May 2023

Histology:	Clear cell variant HCC, CD10 and vimentin positive

Current Situation:	Routine follow-up on sorafenib maintenance

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today for routine follow-up. She continues on sorafenib maintenance therapy which she is tolerating well with only grade 1 palmar-plantar syndrome requiring regular moisturizing. Her most recent CT chest and abdomen from last month shows stable appearances of the two small lung nodules (largest 8mm) with no new lesions identified. Liver function tests remain within normal range. Performance status remains 0 and she continues to work full-time. She denies any new symptoms. The plan is to continue current dose of sorafenib and arrange repeat imaging in 3 months. We will review her again following these scans.

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest and abdomen shows stable appearances of two small lung nodules (largest 8mm) with no new lesions

patient_facts.value: liver function tests within normal range

status_updates.value: Clear cell HCC post hepatectomy with stable small volume lung metastases. Tolerating maintenance sorafenib well with minimal side effects
Grade 1 palmar-plantar syndrome managed with moisturizer
